list_definition.definition: a written list of questions to be answered by a large number of people to provide information for a survey or report

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We were asked to complete a questionnaire.

list_ex_of_english: Two hundred and ninety-seven people took part in the validity and reliability tests of the questionnaire.
An epidemiological investigation was conducted to determine the source of infection and mode of transmission using a structured questionnaire.
This is a large professional group in primary care and was not adequately represented in the questionnaire survey.
Questionnaire on priority assessment of patients referred to orthopedic surgeons showed great differences between reviewers.
Seventy-two controls were enrolled in the study, only one patient refused to answer the questionnaire.
This questionnaire had nine symptoms, each scored on a scale of 1-4.
The cases were sent a questionnaire enquiring about symptoms, usage of the pool, activities undertaken in the swimming pool and use of the inflatable.
This may mean booking a private room for them to complete a questionnaire, offering refreshments, or reducing other factors of burden such as parking.
